article.headline: Senior Fed official says central bank may slow pace of corporate bond purchases
article.body: A senior official at the New York Federal Reserve said the U.S. central bank could slow its pace of corporate debt purchases if financial markets continued to improve. Daleep Singh, head of the New York Fed's markets group, noted the functioning of corporate credit markets had strengthened since the Fed unrolled its emergency lending backstops. Still, Singh said the central bank stood ready to tweak its approach given the uncertainty around a potential wave of bankruptcies from the economic impact of the coronavirus. The iShares iBoxx $ Investment Grade Corporate Bond exchange-traded fund LQD, +0.23% was down a modest 0.1% on Wednesday.
